newsitem.title: USA: Columbia/HCA chief poised to quit - NYT.
newsitem.headline: Columbia/HCA chief poised to quit - NYT.

text.p: Columbia/HCA Healthcare Corp Chairman and Chief Executive Richard Scott appears close to resigning, The New York Times said.
In Friday's edition, the paper cited an unnamed source who said Scott would be gone by the week's end.

Agents from half a dozen Federal agencies are investigating Columbia's Medicare billing practices, a probe that has depressed the company's stock price and dominated takeover discussions with Tenet Healthcare Corp.
Columbia neither confirmed nor denied the rumors, the paper said.

Scott's "take-no-prisoners" style and his success in putting together 340 hospitals and 570 home health care centers into the nation's largest home health network has provoked a backlash of opposition among doctors, hospital executives and attorneys general across the country, the article said.
People eager for the Tenet deal hope that banishing Scott could open a door to settling the various fraud investigations, the paper said.
